intro: Trichoa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to regions of Central and South America. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Trichoa is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in some areas. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types make it a notable species in ecological studies.
